S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Administrative Division
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Administrative division is a generic term for an administrative region within a country at a level below that of the sovereign state.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Application profile
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: name of an application profile that can be used with the online resource (ISO 19115)

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Ballast
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Whether the vessel is in ballast

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Call Name
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The designated call name of a station, e.g. radio station, radar station, pilot.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: This is the name used when calling a radio station by radio i.e. "Singapore Pilots".

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Call sign
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The designated call-sign of a radio station.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Cardinal direction
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Principal and intermediate compass points.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: N
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: north

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: NNE
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: northnortheast

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: NE
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Northeast

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: ENE
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: eastnortheast

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: E
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: east

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: ESE
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: eastsoutheast

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: SE
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: southeast

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: SSE
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: southsoutheast

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: S
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: south

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: SSW
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: southsouthwest

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: SW
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: southwest

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: WSW
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: westsouthwest

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: W
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: west

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: WNW
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: westnorthwest

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: NW
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: northwest

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: NNW
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: northnorthwest

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of authority
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The type of person, government agency or organisation granted powers of managing or controlling access to and/or activity in an area

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: customs
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The agency or establishment for collecting duties, tolls. (Merriam-Websters online Dictionary 23rd February 2006, amended).

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: border control
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The administration to prevent or detect and prosecute violations of rules and regulations at international boundaries (adapted from Merriam-Websters online Dictionary 23rd February 2006).

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: police
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The department of government, or civil force, charged with maintaining public order. (Adapted from OED)

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: port
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Person or corporation, owners of, or entrusted with or invested with the power of managing a port. May be called a Harbour Board, Port Trust, Port Commission, Harbour Commission, Marine Department (NP 100 8th Edition 14 Oct 2004)

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: immigration
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The authority controlling people entering a country.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: health
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The authority with responsibility for checking the validity of the health declaration of a vessel and for declaring free pratique.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: coast guard
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Organisation keeping watch on shipping and coastal waters according to governmental law; normally the authority with reponsibility for search and rescue.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: agricultural
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The authority with responsibility for preventing infection of the agriculture of a country and for the protection of the agricultural interests of a country.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: military
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A military authority which provides control of access to or approval for transit through designated areas or airspace.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: private company
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A private or publicly owned company or commercial enterprise which exercises control of facilities, for example a callibration area.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: maritime police
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A governmental or military force with jurisdiction in territorial waters. Examples could include Gendarmerie Maritime, Carabinierie, and Guardia Civil.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: environmental
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: An authority with responsibility for the protection of the environment.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: fishery
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: An authority with responsibility for the control of fisheries.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: finance
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: an authority with responsibility for the control and movement of money.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: maritime
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A national or regional authority charged with administration of maritime affairs.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of broadcast/communication
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Classification of broadcast or communications based on public availability and commercial/non-commercial nature.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: commercial
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A service operated with the intention of earning money

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: non-commercial
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A service without any financial interest

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: public
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A service available for the general community

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: non-public
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A service available for limited and pre-defined customers

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of cargo
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Classification of the different types of cargo that a ship may be carrying

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: bulk
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Normally dry cargo which is transported to and from the vessel on conveyors or grabs

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: container
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: One of a number of standard sized cargo carrying units, secured using standard corner attachments and bars

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: general
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Break bulk cargo normally loaded by crane

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: category of cargo liquid
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Any cargo loaded by pipeline

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: passenger
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A fee paying traveller

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: livestock
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Live animals carried in bulk

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: dangerous or hazardous
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Dangerous or hazardous cargo as described by the IMO International Maritime Dangerous Goods code

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of communication preference
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Classification of frequencies, VHF channels, telephone numbers, or other means of communication based on preference.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: preferred calling
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: the first choice channel or frequency to be used when calling a radio station

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: alternate calling
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a channel or frequency to be used for calling a radio station when the preferred channel or frequency is busy or is suffering from interferenc

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: preferred working
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: the first choice channel or frequency to be used when working with a radio station

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: alternate working
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a channel or frequency to be used for working with a radio station when the preferred working channel or frequency is busy or is suffering from interference

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of dangerous or hazardous cargo
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Classification of dangerous goods or hazardous materials based on the International Maritime Dangerous Goods Code (IMDG Code)

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: IMDG Code Class 1 Div. 1.1
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Explosives, Division 1: substances and articles which have a mass explosion hazard

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: IMDG Code Class 1 Div. 1.2
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Explosives, Division 2: substances and articles which have a projection hazard but not a mass explosion hazard

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: IMDG Code Class 1 Div. 1.3
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Explosives, Division 3: substances and articles which have a fire hazard and either a minor blast hazard or a minor projection hazard or both, but not a mass explosion hazard

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: IMDG Code Class 1 Div. 1.4
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Explosives, Division 4: substances and articles which present no significant hazard

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: IMDG Code Class 1 Div. 1.5
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Explosives, Division 5: very insensitive substances which have a mass explosion hazard

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Class 1: Division 1.6
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Explosives, Division 6: extremely insensitive articles which do not have a mass explosion hazard

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: IMDG Code Class 2 Div. 2.1
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Gases, flammable gases

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: IMDG Code Class 2 Div. 2.2
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Gases, non-flammable, non-toxic gases

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: IMDG Code Class 2 Div. 2.3
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Gases, toxic gases

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: IMDG Code Class 3
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: flammable liquids

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: IMDG Code Class 4 Div. 4.1
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: flammable solids, self-reactive substances and desensitized explosives

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: IMDG Code Class 4 Div. 4.2
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: substances liable to spontaneous combustion

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: IMDG Code Class 4 Div. 4.3
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: substances which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: IMDG Code Class 5 Div. 5.1
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: oxidizing substances

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: IMDG Code Class 5 Div. 5.2
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: organic peroxides

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: IMDG Code Class 6 Div. 6.1
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: toxic substances

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: IMDG Code Class 6. Div. 6.2
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: infectious substances

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: IMDG Code Class 7
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Radioactive material

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: IMDG Code Class 8
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Corrosive substances

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: IMDG Code Class 9
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Miscellaneous dangerous substances and articles

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Harmful Substances in packaged form
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Harmful substances are those substances which are identified as marine pollutants in the International Maritime Dangerous Goods Code (IMDG Code). Packaged form is defined as the forms of containment specified for harmful substances in the IMDG Code. (MARPOL (73/78) Annex III)

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of forecast or warning area
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Classification of weather forecast and weather warning areas based on source of warnings and forecasts.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: World Meteorological Organization (WMO)
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The forecast and warning area defined by WMO

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: National high seas
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The forecast and warning area defined by national authorities covering High Seas

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: National offshore
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The forecast and warning area defined by national authorities covering offshore waters

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: National coastal
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The forecast and warning area defined by national authorities covering coastal waters

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: National inshore
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The forecast and warning area defined by national authorities covering inshore waters

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: National local
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The forecast and warning area defined by national authorities covering local waters

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Ice
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The ice forecast area defined by international or national authorities

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of GMDSS area
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Classification of GMDSS areas based on availability of GMDSS services and GMDSS equipment requirements.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Area A1
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Within range of VHF coast stations with continuous DSC alerting available (about 20 – 30 miles)

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Area A2
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Beyond area A1, but within range of MF coastal stations with continuous DSC alerting available (about l00 miles)

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Area A3
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Beyond the first two areas, but within coverage of geostationary maritime communication satellites (in practice this means Inmarsat). This covers the area between roughly 70 deg N and 70 deg S.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Area A4
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The remaining sea areas. The most important of these is the sea around the North Pole (the area around the South Pole is mostly land). Geostationary satellites, which are positioned above the equator, cannot reach this far.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of landmark
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Classification of prominent cultural and natural features in the landscape
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: S-123 Note: Only landmarks of relevance to radiocommunications are encoded in S-123 datasets, e.g., radio masts used for marine broadcasts if their location needs to be shown

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: dish aerial
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a parabolic aerial for the receipt and transmission of high frequency radio signals.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: mast
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a straight vertical piece of timber or a hollow cylinder.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: tower
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a relatively tall structure which may be used for observation, support, storage or communication etc.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of maritime broadcast
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Classification of maritime broadcast based on the nature of information conveyed.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: navigational warning
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: message containing urgent information relevant to safe navigation broadcast to ships in accordance with the provisions of the International Convention for the Safety of Life at Sea, 1974, as

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: meteorological warning
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: warning of adverse weather conditions

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: ice report
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: report of the ice situation and restrictions to shipping

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: SAR information
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: broadcast message with information about an ongoing SAR operation

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: pirate attack warning
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: warning of possible attack by pirates

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: meteorological forecast
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: broadcast message containing meteorological forecast

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: pilot service message
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: broadcast message about pilot service

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: AIS information
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: broadcast message about AIS information

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: LORAN message
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: broadcast message about the LORAN service

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: SATNAV message
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: broadcast message about Satellite Navigation service

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: gale warning
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: warning of winds of Beaufort force 8 or 9

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: storm warning
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: warning of winds of Beaufort force 10 or over

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: tropical revolving storm warning
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: warning of hurricanes in the North Atlantic and eastern North Pacific, typhoons in the Western Pacific, cyclones in the Indian Ocean and cyclones of similar nature in other regions

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: NAVAREA warning
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: navigational warning or in-force bulletin promulgated as part of a numbered series by a NAVAREA coordinator (Maritime Safety Information Manual 2009)

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: coastal warning
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: navigational warning promulgated as part of a numbered series by a National coordinator (Maritime Safety Information Manual 2009)

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: local warning
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: warning which covers inshore waters, often within the limits of jurisdiction of a harbour or port authority (Maritime Safety Information Manual 2009)

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: low water level warning/negative tidal surge
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: warning of actual or expected low water level

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: icing warning
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: warning of accretion of ice on ships

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: tsunami broadcast
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: broadcasts about tsunamis, including watches, advisories, and other types of messages relating to tsunamis or potential tsunamis

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of radio station
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Classification of radio services offered by a radio station.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: A radiobeacon is a radio transmitter which emits a distinctive or characteristic signal on which a bearing may be taken.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: radio direction-finding station
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A radio station intended to determine only the direction of other stations by means of transmission from the latter.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Decca
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The Decca Navigator System is a high accuracy, short to medium range radio navigational aid intended for coastal and landfall navigation.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Loran C
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A low frequency electronic position fixing system using pulsed transmissions at 100 Khz.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Differential GNSS
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A radiobeacon transmitting DGPS correction signals.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Toran
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: An electronic position fixing system used mainly by aircraft.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Omega
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A long-range radio navigational aid which operates within the VLF frequency band. The system comprises eight land based stations.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Syledis
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A ranging position fixing system operating at 420-450MHz over a range of up to 400Km.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Chaika (Chayka)
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A low frequency electronic position fixing system using pulsed transmissions at 100 KHz.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: facsimile transmission
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Facsimile transmission
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:remarks: Needs definition finalized and listed value to be added (restored?) to category of radio station in GI registry

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: radio telephone station
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The equipment needed at one station to carry on two way voice communication by radio waves only

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: AIS base station
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:remarks: As of August 2017, not defined in registry or S-101 DCEG

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of radio methods
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Categories of radiocommunications based on frequency band and radio traffic method.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Low Frequency (LF) voice traffic
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Frequency in a frequency range between 30 and 300 kHz used for voice traffic

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Medium Frequency (MF) voice traffic
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Frequency in a frequency range between 300 and 3 000kHz used for voice traffic

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: High Frequency (HF) voice traffic
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Frequency in a frequency range between 3 and 30 MHz used for voice traffic

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Very High Frequency (VHF) voice traffic
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Frequency in a frequency range between 30 and 300 MHz used for voice traffic

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: High Frequency Narrow Band Direct Printing
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: High Frequency Narrow Band Direct Printing

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: NAVTEX
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Narrow-band direct-printing telegraphy system for transmission of maritime safety information. (IHO Dictionary, S-32, 5th Edition, 3412)

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: SafetyNET
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: SafetyNET is an international automatic direct-printing satellite-based service for the promulgation of navigational and meteorological warnings, meteorological forecasts and other urgent safety-related messages - maritime safety information (MSI) - to ships. (International SafetyNET Manual, 2003 Edition, IMO Publication Number IA908E)

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: NBDP Telegraphy (Narrow Band Direct Printing Telegraphy)
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A communications system consisting of teletypewriters connected to a telephonic network to send and receive Narrow Band Direct Printing. (Adapted American Heritage Dictionary)

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: facsimile
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A method or device for transmitting documents, drawings, photographs, or the like, by means of radio or telephone for exact reproduction elsewhere.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: NAVIP
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A Russian system transmitting navigational information, send by radio and containing information relevant to coastal waters of foreign countries and high seas. (Central Marine Research and Design Institute, St.-Petersburg, Russia)

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Low Frequency (LF) digital traffic
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Frequency in a frequency range between 30 and 300 kHz used for digital traffic

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Medium Frequency (MF) digital traffic
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Frequency in a frequency range between 300 and 3000kHz used for digital traffic

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: High Frequency (HF) digital traffic
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Frequency in a frequency range between 3 and 30 MHz used for digital traffic

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Very High Frequency (VHF) digital traffic
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Frequency in a frequency range between 30 and 300 MHz used for digital traffic

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Low Frequency (LF) telegraph traffic
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Frequency in a frequency range between 30 and 300 kHz used for telegraph traffic

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Medium Frequency (MF) telegraph traffic
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Frequency in a frequency range between 300 and 3 000kHz used for telegraph traffic

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: High Frequency (HF) telegraph traffic
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Frequency in a frequency range between 3 and 30 MHz used for telegraph traffic

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Medium Frequency (MF) Digital Selective Call traffic
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Frequency in a frequency range between 300 and 3000kHz used for Digital Selective Call traffic

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: High Frequency (HF) Digital Selective Call traffic
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Frequency in a frequency range between 3 and 30 MHz used for Digital Selective Call traffic

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Very High Frequency (VHF) Digital Selective Call traffic
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Frequency in a frequency range between 30 and 300 MHz used for Digital Selective Call traffic

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of relationship
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Expresses constraints or requirements on vessel actions or activities in relation to a geographic feature, facility, or service

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: prohibited
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: use of facility, waterway or service is forbidden

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: not recommended
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: use of facility, waterway or service is not recommended

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: permitted
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: use of facility, waterway, or service is permitted but not required

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: recommended
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: use of facility, waterway, or service is recommended

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: required
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: use of facility, waterway, or service is required

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: not required
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: use of facility, waterway, or service is not required

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of temporal variation
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: An assessment of the likelihood of change within an area since last survey.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: S-123 Note: NPUB, DQWG, and S-101 definitions still to be harmonized by the working groups

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: extreme event
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: No new hydrographic survey conducted after an event (e.g. hurricane, earthquake, volcanic eruption, landslide, etc), which is considered likely to have changed the seafloor significantly.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: likely to change
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Continuous or frequent change (e.g. river siltation, sand waves, seasonal storms, icebergs, etc).

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: unlikely to change
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Significant change to the seafloor is not expected.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: unassessed
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Temporal variation not assessed or cannot be determined.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of text
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Classification of completeness of textual information in relation to the source.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: abstract or summary
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A statement summarizing the important points of a text

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: extract
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: An excerpt or excerpts from a text

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: full text
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The whole text

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of vessel registry
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The locality of vessel registration or enrolment relative to the nationality of a port, territorial sea, administrative area, exclusive zone or other location.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: domestic
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The vessel is registered or enrolled under the same national flag as the port, harbour, territorial sea, exclusive economic zone, or administrative area in which the object that possesses this attribute applies or is located.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: foreign
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The vessel is registered or enrolled under a national flag different from the port, harbour, territorial sea, exclusive economic zone, or other administrative area in which the object that possesses this attribute applies or is located.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: City name
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The name of a town or city.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Communication channel
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: A channel number assigned to a specific radio frequency, frequencies or frequency band.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: The expected input is the specific VHF-Channel. The attribute 'communication channel' encodes the various VHF-channels used for communication.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Comparison Operator
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Numerical comparison
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: The definition of COMPOP provides the relation between the value given in the model and the real ship's value.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: greater than
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The value of the left value is greater than that of the right.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: greater than or equal to
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The value of the left expression is greater than or equal to that of the right.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: less than
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The value of the left expression is less than that of the right.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: less than or equal to
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The value of the left expression is less than or equal to that of the right.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: equal to
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The two values are equivalent.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: not equal to
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The two values are not equivalent.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Contact instructions
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Instructions provided on how to contact a particular person, organisation or service.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Country
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The name of a nation. (Adapted from The American Heritage Dictionaries)

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Data assessment
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The categorisation of the assessment level of bathymetric data for an area.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: assessed
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The quality of the bathymetric data has been assessed.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: oceanic
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The quality of oceanic bathymetric data has been assessed or is not required.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: unassessed
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Not having been assessed.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Day Of Week
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The days of the week
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: This is an ordered enumeration

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: monday
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: the day of the week before Tuesday and following Sunday

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: tuesday
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: the day of the week before Wednesday and following Monday

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: wednesday
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: the day of the week before Thursday and following Tuesday

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: thursday
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: the day of the week before Friday and following Wednesday

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: friday
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: the day of the week before Saturday and following Thursday

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: saturday
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: the day of the week before Sunday and following Friday (together with Sunday forms part of the weekend)

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: sunday
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: the day of the week before Monday and following Saturday (together with Saturday forms part of the weekend)

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Day of week is range
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: A statement expressing if the days of the week identified define a range or not.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Date end
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The latest date on which an object (e.g., a buoy) will be present.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: This attribute is to be used to indicate the removal or cancellation of an object at a specific date in the future. See also 'periodic date end' (PEREND).

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Date fixed
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The date when a festival or national holiday recurs on the same day each year in the Gregorian calendar.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Date start
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The earliest date on which an object (e.g., a buoy) will be present.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: This attribute is to be used to indicate the deployment or implementation of an object at a specific date in the future. See also 'periodic date start' (PERSTA).

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Date variable
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: A day which is not fixed in the Gregorian calendar.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: Examples: The fourth Thursday in November; new moon day of Kartika (Diwali); Easter Sunday.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Delivery point
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Details of where post can be delivered such as the apartment, name and/or number of a street, building or PO Box.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Direction uncertainty
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The best estimate of the accuracy of a bearing.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Display name
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: A statement expressing if a feature name is to be displayed in certain system display settings or not

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Distance
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: A linear extent of space

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Drum speed
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The drum speed in revolutions per minute.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: The drum speed should be encoded using three digits for the speed including a leading zero if necessary.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Estimated range of transmission
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: A linear extent of space
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: The estimated range (distance) assumes 'in vacuo' transmission and a standard antenna height of 5 metres. Thus it gives a hint to the mariner whether he is likely to receive transmission at a certain distance from an object carrying this attribute.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: File Locator
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The string encodes the location of a fragment of text or other information in a support file.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: File Reference
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The string encodes the file name of an external text file that contains the text in English

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Fixed Date
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The date when a festival or national holiday recurs on the same day each year in the Gregorian calendar.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Flip bearing
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The bearing at which text is re-located to the opposite side of a feature when screen display is oriented away from true north.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Frequency Shore Station Receives
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The shore station receiver frequency expressed in kHz to one decimal place.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: Examples: 4379.1 kHz becomes 043791; 13162.8 kHz becomes 131628

S100FC:uom.S100Base:name: kHz
S100FC:uom.S100Base:definition: Kilohertz to 1 decimal place converted to an integer

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Frequency Shore Station Transmits
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The shore station transmitter frequency expressed in kHz to one decimal place.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: Examples: 4379.1 kHz becomes 043791; 13162.8 kHz becomes 131628

S100FC:uom.S100Base:name: kHz
S100FC:uom.S100Base:definition: Kilohertz to 1 decimal place converted to an integer

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Function
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: A specific role that describes a feature

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: communication
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: transmitting and/or receiving electronic communication signals.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: radio
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: broadcast of radio signals.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: microwave
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: broadcasting and receiving signals using microwaves.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: control
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: used to control the flow of air, rail, or marine traffic.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: sea rescue control
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A unit responsible for promoting efficient organization of search and rescue services and for coordinating the conduct of search and rescue operations within a search and rescue region.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Headline
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Words set at the head of a passage or page to introduce or categorize

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Horizontal distance uncertainty
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The best estimate of the horizontal accuracy of horizontal clearances and distances.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: the error is assumed to be positive and negative. The plus/minus character must not be encoded.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Index of cooperation
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: A factor governing the image resolution of radiofax transmissions.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: (i) The Index of Cooperation must be known to decode the transmission; (ii) The Index of Co-operation is generally 576, although 288 with alternate line scanning is sometimes used.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Information confidence
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The likelihood that a vessel will experience the phenomenon described by a feature, or that the service described by the feature will be available.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: virtuallyCertain
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Virtually certain to be experienced by (or available to) an individual vessel; will be experienced by nearly all vessels. (FAA, adapted.)

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: highLikelihood
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Frequently experienced by (or available to) an individual vessel; experienced by a majority of vessels. (FAA, adapted.)

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: mediumLikelihood
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Occasionally experienced by (or available to) an individual vessel; experienced by (or available to) about half of all vessels. (FAA, adapted.)

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: lowLikelihood
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Unlikely, but sometimes (rarely) experienced by (or available to) an individual vessel; experienced by (or available to) a minority of vessels). (FAA, adapted.)

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Is MRCC
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: A True value is an indication that the encoded coastguard station performs the function of a Maritime Rescue and Coordination Centre
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: In S-123 datasets, only MRCC or MRSC coastguard stations are encoded, so the value of this attribute should be TRUE for all instances in an S-123 dataset

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Language
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The method of human communication, either spoken or written, consisting of the use of words in a structured and conventional way
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: (S-122)Remarks: The language is encoded by a character code following ISO 639-3

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Language information
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: A description of the languages, alphabets and scripts in use.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Logical Connectives
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Expresses whether all the constraints described by its co-attributes must be satisfied, or only one such constraint need be satisfied.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: This attribute is intended to be used with co-attributes that encode limits on vessel dimensions, type of cargo, and other characteristics. The combination of constraints described by logicalConnective and its co-attributes defines a subset of vessels to which information described by a feature or information type instance applies (or does not apply, is required, recommended, etc.). The relationship between the vessel subset and the information is indicated by an association - see PermissionType and InclusionType). The two listed values of logicalConnective are two of the basic operations of Boolean logic. The third basic operation (not) is not used.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: logical conjunction
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: all the conditions described by the other attributes of the object, or sub-attributes of the same complex attribute, are true

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: logical disjunction
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: at least one of the conditions described by the other attributes of the object, or sub-attributes of the same complex attributes, is true

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Linkage
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: location (address) for on-line access using a URL/URI address or similar addressing scheme. (Adapted from ISO 19115:2014.)
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: Adapted from ISO 19115:2014.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Membership
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: indicates whether a vessel is included or excluded from the regulation / restriction / recommendation / nautical information

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: included
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Vessels with these characteristics are included in the regulation/restriction/recommendation/nautical information

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: excluded
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Vessels with these characteristics are excluded from the regulation/restriction/recommendation/nautical information

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: MMSI Code
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The Maritime Mobile Service Identity (MMSI) Code is formed of a series of nine digits which are transmitted over the radio path in order to uniquely identify ship stations, ship earth stations, coast stations, coast earth stations, and group calls. These identities are formed in such a way that the identity or part thereof can be used by telephone and telex subscribers connected to the general telecommunications network principally to call ships automatically.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Minute past even hours
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The minute past even hours when a routine transmission starts.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Minute past every hour
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The minute past every hour when a routine transmission starts.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: Transmissions more than once every hour can be indicated by repeating the attribute.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Minute past odd hours
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The minute past odd hours when a routine transmission starts.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Name
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The individual name of a feature.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Name of resource
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Name of the online resource.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Nationality
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The nationality of the specific object
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: The nationality is encoded by a 2 character code following ISO 3166. The attribute “nationality” indicates the nationality of the specific feature. Where it is required to encode multiple nationalities relevant to a single feature (for example, for a maritime jurisdiction area that is in dispute between two Coastal States), this must be done by populating the character codes for both Coastal States, delimited by a comma.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Observation time
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The time on each day when observations are made.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Online description
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Detailed text description of what the online resource is/does

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Operation
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Indicates whether the minimum or maximum value should be used to describe a condition or in application processing

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: largest value
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The numerically largest value computed from the applicable attributes or sub-attributes

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: smallest value
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The numerically smallest value computed from the applicable attributes or sub-attributes

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Orientation uncertainty
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The best estimate of the accuracy of a bearing.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Picture caption
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Short description of the purpose of the image

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Picture information
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: A set of information to provide credits to picture creator, copyright owner etc.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Postal code
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Known in various countries as a postcode, or ZIP code, the postal code is a series of letters and/or digits that identifies each postal delivery area.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Protocol
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: connection protocol to be used. Example: ftp, http get KVP, http POST, etc.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Protocol request
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Request used to access the resource. Structure and content depend on the protocol and standard used by the online resource, such as Web Feature Service standard.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Reported date
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The date that the item was observed, done, or investigated

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Scale maximum
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The maximum scale at which the object may be used, e.g., for ECDIS presentation.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: The modulus of the scale is indicated, that is 1:25 000 is encoded as 25000.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Scale minimum
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The minimum scale at which the object may be used, e.g., for ECDIS presentation.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: The modulus of the scale is indicated, that is 1:1 250 000 is encoded as 1250000.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Signal frequency
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The frequency of a signal.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Source
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: An identifier (publication, document, reference work, instrument, vessel, etc) from which information comes or is acquired.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Source type
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: type of the source

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: law or regulation
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: reaty, convention, or international agreement; law or regulation issued by a national or other authority

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: official publication
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: publication not having the force of law, issued by an international organisation or a national or local administration

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: mariner report, confirmed
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Reported by mariner(s) and confirmed by another source

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: mariner report, not confirmed
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: reported by mariner(s) but not confirmed

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: industry publications and reports
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: shipping and other industry publication, including graphics, charts and web sites

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: remotely sensed images
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: information obtained from satellite images

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: photographs
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: information obtained from photographs

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: products issued by HO services
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: information obtained from products issued by Hydrographic Offices

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: news media
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: information obtained from news media

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: traffic data
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: information obtained from the analysis of traffic data

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Status
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The condition of an object at a given instant in time.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: permanent
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: intended to last or function indefinitely.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: occasional
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: acting on special occasions happening irregularly.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: recommended
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: presented as worthy of confidence, acceptance, use, etc.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: not in use
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: no longer used for the purpose intended disused.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: periodic/intermittent
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: recurring at intervals.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: reserved
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: set apart for some specific use.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: temporary
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: meant to last only for a time.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: private
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: not in public ownership or operation.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: mandatory
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: compulsory enforced.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: extinguished
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: no longer lit

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: illuminated
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: lit by floodlights, strip lights, etc.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: historic
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: famous in history of historical interest.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: public
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: belonging to, available to, used or shared by, the community as a whole and not restricted to private use.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: synchronized
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: occur at a time, coincide in point of time, be contemporary or simultaneous.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: watched
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: looked at or observed over a period of time especially so as to be aware of any movement or change.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: un-watched
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: usually automatic in operation, without any permanently-stationed personnel to superintend it.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: existence doubtful
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: an object that has been reported but has not been definitely determined to exist.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: buoyed
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Marked by buoys

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Telecommunication identifier
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: An identifier, such as words, numbers, letters, symbols, or any combination of those used to establish a contact to a particular person, organisation or service.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Telecommunication carrier
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The name of a provider or type of carrier for a telecommunication service. This service may include land line based, shore based or satellite based radio connections.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Text
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: A non-formatted digital text string

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Thickness of ice capability
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The thickness of ice that the ship can safely transit

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Time reference
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Indicates whether a time value is local time or Coordinated Universal Time.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: Local time is the local civil time after daylight savings time (if any) has been applied. For example 0800 local time in New York is the same instant as 1300 UTC on December 1, when DST is not in effect in New York, and 1200 UTC on June 1, when DST is in effect in New York.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: localTime
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Local time

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: UTC
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Universal Coordinated Time

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Time of day end
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Ending time of day, possibly for a period within the day

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Time of day start
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Starting time of day, possibly for a period within the day

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Transmission content
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Content of transmission
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: Other than MSI.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Transmission power
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The maximum power the radio service uses (or is authorized to use) for radio transmission.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: The calculation of the power depends on the type of signal. The value encoded must be the actual transmission power, if this is known to be different from the authorized transmission power. (47 CFR 80.215 (19 April 2017), adapted.)

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Transmission time
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The time in the day when scheduled transmissions start

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Uncertainty fixed
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The best estimate of the fixed vertical accuracy component for depths, heights, vertical distances and vertical clearances.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: The maximum of the one-dimensional error. The error is assumed to be positive and negative. The plus/minus character must not be encoded. Note: Definition may need to be updated if it is used for horizontal measurements too?

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Uncertainty variable
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The best estimate of the variable vertical accuracy component for depths, heights, vertical distances and vertical clearances.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: The maximum of the one-dimensional error. The error is assumed to be positive and negative. The plus/minus character must not be encoded. Note: Definition may need to be updated if it is used for horizontal measurements too?

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Vessels characteristics
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Characteristics of vessels

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: length overall
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The maximum length of the ship (L.O.A.). (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ship_measurements; 24 July 2010)

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: length at waterline
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The ship's length measured at the waterline (L.W.L.). (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ship_measurements; 24 July 2010)

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: breadth
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The width or beam of the vessel.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: draught
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The depth of water necessary to float a vessel fully loaded.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: height
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The height of the highest point of a vessel's structure (e.g. radar aerial, funnel, cranes, masthead) above her waterline. (UKHO NP100/2009)

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: displacement tonnage
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A measurement of the weight of the vessel, usually used for warships. (Merchant ships are usually measured based on the volume of cargo space; see tonnage). Displacement is expressed either in long tons of 2,240 pounds or metric tonnes of 1,000 kg. Since the two units are very close in size (2,240 pounds = 1,016 kg and 1,000 kg = 2,205 pounds), it is common not to distinguish between them. To preserve secrecy, nations sometimes misstate a warship's displacement. (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ship_measurements; 24 July 2010)

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: displacement tonnage, light
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The weight of the ship excluding cargo, fuel, ballast, stores, passengers, and crew, but with water in the boilers to steaming level. (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ship_measurements; 24 July 2010)

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: displacement tonnage, loaded
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The weight of the ship including cargo, passengers, fuel, water, stores, dunnage and such other items necessary for use on a voyage, which brings the vessel down to her load draft. (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ship_measurements; 24 July 2010)

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: deadweight tonnage
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The difference between displacement, light and displacement, loaded. A measure of the ship's total carrying capacity. (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ship_measurements; 24 July 2010)

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: gross tonnage
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The entire internal cubic capacity of the ship expressed in tons of 100 cubic feet to the ton, except certain spaces with are exempted such as: peak and other tanks for water ballast, open forecastle bridge and poop, access of hatchways, certain light and air spaces, domes of skylights, condenser, anchor gear, steering gear, wheel house, galley and cabin for passengers. (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ship_measurements; 24 July 2010)

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: net tonnage
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Obtained from the gross tonnage by deducting crew and navigating spaces and allowances for propulsion machinery.(http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ship_measurements; 24 July 2010)

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Panama Canal/Universal Measurement System net tonnage
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: the Panama Canal/Universal Measurement System (PC/UMS) is based on net tonnage, modified for Panama Canal purposes. PC/UMS is based on a mathematical formula to calculate a vessel's total volume; a PC/UMS net ton is equivalent to 100 cubic feet of capacity. (Adapted from http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tonnage 4 Oct 2010)

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Suez Canal net tonnage
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: the Suez Canal Net Tonnage (SCNT) is derived with a number of modifications from the former net register tonnage of the Moorsom System and was established by the International Commission of Constantinople in its Protocol of 18 December 1873. It is still in use, as amended by the Rules of Navigation of the Suez Canal Authority, and is registered in the Suez Canal Tonnage Certificate. (Adapted from http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tonnage 4 Oct 2010)

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Suez Canal gross tonnage
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Suez Canal Gross Tonnage (SCGT) is derived with a number of modifications from the former net register tonnage of the Moorsom System and was established by the International Commission of Constantinople in its Protocol of 18 December 1873. It is still in use, as amended by the Rules of Navigation of the Suez Canal Authority, and is registered in the Suez Canal Tonnage Certificate.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Vessels characteristics unit
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: the unit used for vessel characteristics attribute

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: metre
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The metre (or meter) is the base unit of length in the International System of Units (SI). It is defined as the distance travelled by light in vacuum in 1/299,792,458 of a second.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: foot
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A foot (plural: feet) is a non-SI unit of length in a number of different systems including English units, Imperial units, and United States customary units. The most commonly used foot today is the international foot. There are three feet in a yard and 12 inches in a foot.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: metric ton
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The tonne or metric ton (U.S.), often redundantly referred to as a metric tonne, is a unit of mass equal to 1,000 kg (2,205 lb) or approximately the mass of one cubic metre of water at four degrees Celsius. It is sometimes abbreviated as mt in the United States, but this conflicts with other SI symbols. The tonne is not a unit in the International System of Units (SI), but is accepted for use with the SI. In SI units and prefixes, the tonne is a megagram (Mg). The Imperial and US customary units comparable to the tonne are both spelled ton in English, though they differ in mass. Pronunciation of tonne (the word used in the UK) and ton is usually identical, but is not too confusing unless accuracy is important as the tonne and UK long ton differ by only 1.6%.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: ton
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Long ton (weight ton or imperial ton) is the name for the unit called the "ton" in the avoirdupois or Imperial system of measurements, as used in the United Kingdom and several other Commonwealth countries. It has been mostly replaced by the tonne, and in the United States by the short ton. One long ton is equal to 2,240 pounds (1,016 kg) or 35 cubic feet (0.9911 m3) of salt water with a density of 64 lb/ft³ (1.025 g/ml). It has some limited use in the United States, most commonly in measuring the displacement of ships, and was the unit prescribed for warships by the Washington Naval Treaty—for example battleships were limited to a mass of 35,000 long tons (36,000 t; 39,000 ST).

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: short ton
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The short ton is a unit of weight equal to 2,000 pounds (907.18474 kg). In the United States it is often called simply ton without distinguishing it from the metric ton (tonne, 1,000 kilograms) or the long ton (2,240 pounds / 1,016.0469088 kilograms); rather, the other two are specifically noted. There are, however, some U.S. applications for which unspecified tons normally means long tons (for example, Navy ships) or metric tons (world grain production figures). Both the long and short ton are defined as 20 hundredweights, but a hundredweight is 100 pounds (45.359237 kg) in the U.S. system (short or net hundredweight) and 112 pounds (50.80234544 kg) in the Imperial system (long or gross hundredweight).

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: gross ton
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition:
Gross tonnage (GT) is a function of the volume of all ship's enclosed spaces (from keel to funnel) measured to the outside of the hull framing. There is a sliding scale factor. So GT is a kind of capacity-derived index that is used to rank a ship for purposes of determining manning, safety and other statutory requirements and is expressed simply as GT, which is a unitless entity, even though its derivation is tied to the cubic meter unit of volumetric capacity.
Tonnage measurements are now governed by an IMO Convention (International Convention on Tonnage Measurement of Ships, 1969 (London-Rules)), which applies to all ships built after July 1982. In accordance with the Convention, the correct term to use now is GT, which is a function of the moulded volume of all enclosed spaces of the ship.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: net ton
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Net tonnage (NT) is based on a calculation of the volume of all cargo spaces of the ship. It indicates a vessel’s earning space and is a function of the moulded volume of all cargo spaces of the ship.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Panama Canal/Universal Measurement System net tonnage
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The Panama Canal/Universal Measurement System (PC/UMS) is based on net tonnage, modified for Panama Canal purposes. PC/UMS is based on a mathematical formula to calculate a vessel's total volume; a PC/UMS net ton is equivalent to 100 cubic feet of capacity.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Suez Canal Net Tonnage
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The Suez Canal Net Tonnage (SCNT) is derived with a number of modifications from the former net register tonnage of the Moorsom System and was established by the International Commission of Constantinople in its Protocol of 18 December 1873. It is still in use, as amended by the Rules of Navigation of the Suez Canal Authority, and is registered in the Suez Canal Tonnage Certificate.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: none
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Can be used for net and gross tonnages, including Panama Canal/Universal Measurement System net tonnage and The Suez Canal Net Tonnage.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: cubic metres
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Cubic metres

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Suez Canal Gross Tonnage
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The Suez Canal Gross Tonnage (SCGT) is derived with a number of modifications from the former net register tonnage of the Moorsom System and was established by the International Commission of Constantinople in its Protocol of 18 December 1873. It is still in use, as amended by the Rules of Navigation of the Suez Canal Authority, and is registered in the Suez Canal Tonnage Certificate.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Vessels characteristics value
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The value of a particular characteristic such as a dimension or tonnage of a vessel

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Vessel performance
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: A description of the required handling characteristics of a vessel including hull design, main and auxilliary machinery, cargo handling equipment, navigation equipment and manoeuvring behaviour.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Quality of horizontal measurement
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The degree of reliability attributed to a position

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: surveyed
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: the position(s) was(were) determined by the operation of making measurements for determining the relative position of points on, above or beneath the earth's surface. Survey implies a regular, controlled survey of any date.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: unsurveyed
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: survey data is does not exist or is very poor.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: inadequately surveyed
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: position data is of a very poor quality.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: approximate
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a position that is considered to be less than third-order accuracy, but is generally considered to be within 30.5 metres of its correct geographic location. Also may apply to an object whose position does not remain fixed.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: position doubtful
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: an object whose position has been reported but which is considered to be doubtful.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: unreliable
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: an object's position obtained from questionable or unreliable data.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: reported (not surveyed)
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: an object whose position has been reported and its position confirmed by some means other than a formal survey such as an independent report of the same object.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: reported (not confirmed)
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: an object whose position has been reported and its position has not been confirmed.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: estimated
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: the most probable position of an object determined from incomplete data or data of questionable accuracy.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: precisely known
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a position that is of a known value, such as the position of an anchor berth or other defined object.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: calculated
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a position that is computed from data.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Maximum display scale
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The largest intended viewing scale for the data.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Minimum display scale
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The smallest intended viewing scale for the data.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Orientation value
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The angular distance measured from true north to the major axis of the object.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Periodic date end
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The end of the active period for a seasonal object (e.g., a buoy).
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: See also 'date end' (DATEND).

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Periodic date start
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The start of the active period for a seasonal object (e.g., a buoy).
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: See also 'date start' (DATSTA).

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Pictorial representation
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Indicates whether a pictorial representation of the object is available.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: The 'pictorial representation' could be a drawing or a photo. The string encodes the file name of an external graphic file (pixel/vector).

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Sector bearing
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: A sector is the part of a circle between two straight lines drawn from the centre to the circumference. Sector bearing specifies the limit of the sector. (Adapted from S-57 Edition 3.1, Appendix A – Chapter 2, Page 2.184, November 2000).
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: -The values given to the common limits of adjacent sectors should be identical. - The orientation of the bearing is from seaward to the central feature. This conforms with the method used in “List of Lights” publications. - A generic term such as “to shore” cannot be used; a specific bearing must be encoded. Where a light sector limit is defined as “to the shore”, it should be encoded using a value that ensures that, when the limit is drawn, it will fall entirely on land.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Selective call number
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: When stations of the maritime mobile service (direct printing telegraphy) use selective calling devices, their Selective Call numbers (SELCAL) are formed of four digits (coast stations). (Adapted: Radio Regulations (ITU))

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Source date
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The production date of the source, e.g., the date of measurement.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Transmission of traffic lists
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Describes whether a station transmits traffic lists

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Transmission regularity
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Classification of regularity or conditions for transmission

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: continuous
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: transmission is made continuously

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: regular
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: transmission is made regularly according to a schedule

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: on receipt
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: transmission is made when warning or information is received from another authority

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: as required
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: transmission is made under specified conditions or when needed

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: on request
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: transmission is made when requested by a user

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Transmitter identification character
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The NAVTEX transmitter identification character is a single unique letter, which is allocated to each transmitter. It is used to identify the broadcasts, which are to be accepted by the receiver, those which are to be rejected, and the time slot for the transmission.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: The transmitter identification character should be indicated by a single character (A-Z)

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Variable Date
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: A day which is not fixed in the Gregorian calendar.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Action or activity
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The action or activity of a vessel
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: codeListType=open enumeration; encoding=other: [something]

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: navigating with a pilot
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Carrying a qualified pilot as part of the vessel navigation team.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: entering port
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Navigating a vessel into a port

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: leaving port
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Navigating a vessel out of a port.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: berthing
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Attaching a vessel to a wharf or jetty

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: slipping
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Detaching a vessel from a wharf or jetty.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: anchoring
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Attaching a vessel to the seabed by means of an anchor and cable.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: weighing anchor
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Detaching a vessel from the seabed by recovering an anchor and cable.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: transiting
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Navigating a vessel along a route or through a narrow gap, such as under a bridge or through a lock.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: overtaking
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Navigating a vessel past another traveling broadly in the same direction.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: reporting
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Providing details such as the name, location or intentions of a vessel

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: working cargo
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Loading or unloading cargo

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: landing
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Placing crew or passengers on shore

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: diving
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Placing a swimmer with an air supply below the sea surface.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: fishing
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Hunting or catching fish

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: discharging overboard
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Releasing anything into the sea; often ballast water; or spoil from dredging elsewhere.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: passing
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Navigating a vessel past another traveling broadly in the opposite direction.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of RxN
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The principal subject matter of regulations, restrictions, recommendations or nautical information
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: codeListType=open enumeration; encoding=other: [something]

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: navigation
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: pertaining to navigation

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: communication
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: pertaining to communication

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: environmental protection
